org.jlab.coda.emu.support.data

Class ByteBufferItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jlab.coda.emu.support.data.ByteBufferItem

  • public class ByteBufferItem
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is used in conjunction with the ByteBufferSupply class to provide a very fast supply of ByteBuffer objects for reuse. Objects of this class are used to populate the ring buffer in ByteBufferSupply. Uses the Disruptor software package.
    Author:
    timmer (4/14/14)

      • myIndex

        public int myIndex
        Auxiliary integer storage. Used to store pool ID.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ByteBufferItem

        ByteBufferItem(int bufferSize,
               java.nio.ByteOrder order,
               boolean direct,
               boolean orderedRelease,
               int myId)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - size in bytes of ByteBuffer to construct.
        order - byte order of ByteBuffer to construct.
        direct - is the buffer direct (in memory not managed by JVM) or not.
        orderedRelease - if true, release ByteBufferItems in same order as acquired.
        myId - unique id of this object.

      • ByteBufferItem

        ByteBufferItem(int bufferSize,
               java.nio.ByteOrder order,
               boolean direct,
               boolean orderedRelease,
               int myId,
               java.lang.Object auxObject,
               int auxIndex)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - size in bytes of ByteBuffer to construct.
        order - byte order of ByteBuffer to construct.
        direct - is the buffer direct (in memory not managed by JVM) or not.
        orderedRelease - if true, release ByteBufferItems in same order as acquired.
        myId - unique id of this object.
        auxObject - auxiliary object to store.
        auxIndex - auxiliary integer to store.

      • ByteBufferItem

        ByteBufferItem(java.nio.ByteBuffer templateBuf,
               boolean orderedRelease,
               int myId)
        Constructor used to initially fill each ByteBufferItem of a ByteBufferSupply with a copy of a template buffer.
        Parameters:
        templateBuf - this item's buffer is a copy this of template ByteBuffer.
        orderedRelease - if true, release ByteBufferItems in same order as acquired.
        myId - unique id of this object.

      • setUsers

        public void setUsers(int users)
        Set the number of users of this buffer. If multiple users of the buffer exist, keep track of all until last one is finished.
        Parameters:
        users - number of buffer users

      • getUsers

        public int getUsers()
        Get the number of users of this buffer.
        Returns:
        number of users of this buffer.

      • decrementCounter

        boolean decrementCounter()
        Called by buffer user by way of ByteBufferSupply.release(ByteBufferItem) if no longer using it so it may be reused later.
        Returns:
        true if no one using buffer now, else false.

      • addUsers

        public void addUsers(int additionalUsers)
        If a reference to this ByteBufferItem is copied, then it is necessary to increase the number of users. Although this method is not safe to call in general, it is safe, for example, if a RingItem is copied in the ER BEFORE it is copied again onto multiple output channels' rings and then released. Currently this is only used in just such a situation - in the ER when a ring item must be copied and placed on all extra output channels. In this case, there is always at least one existing user.
        Parameters:
        additionalUsers - number of users to add
